H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H5181.def: = action by which humans or supernatural beings move down from a place of higher elevation

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4974.def: = part of the body that is healthy and unaffected by a sickness or other affliction

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H2195.def: = action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H3515.def: = state in which an object has relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H2250.def: = area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by sickness or aggression; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances

H887.def: = process by which objects such as dead animals, plants, or wounds give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive

H4743.def: = process by which wounds or parts of the human body decompose

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H5753.def: = causative action by which deities change the shape of an object ► with the purpose of destroying it

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6937.def: = process by which an object becomes dark in color

H3689.def: = area of the body located on both sides of the spine between the ribs the the hip; location where fat can accumulate

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H7033.def: = causative action by which humans expose other humans to the heat of fire; ► which will result in excessive suffering and/or death; ≈ also used in a more figurative sense for the burning sensation caused by high fever

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4974.def: = part of the body that is healthy and unaffected by a sickness or other affliction

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H6313.def: = state in which humans lack physical strength

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1794.def: literally: to crush; hence: = causative by which a deity inflicts deadly wounds on a individual or group ◄ as if crushing that person or those people with a heavy object

H7580.def: = action by which animals, humans, or deities produce a full, deep, prolonged sound as made by a lion; ≈ associated with aggression, but also with suffering

H5100.def: = process by which an inanimate object makes a deep inarticulate sound; ≈ usually regarded as menacing

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H8378.def: = process by which someone senses a physical craving for food

H585.def: = act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

glosses: to move about freely > to trade
H5503.def: = action of moving from place to place ► to carry out activities of commerce

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H5061.def: = a disease or sickness or wound ◄ caused by another person or sent from God or a deity ► to punish a person or nation for some wrong or disobedience

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5367.def: = causative action by which humans try to gain control over other humans in an unjust way, ◄ as if they were animals caught in a net or trap

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H1942.def: = state of experiencing an urge to see something happen or do something oneself; ◄ usually evil

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2795.def: = state in which humans or animals are unable to perceive with the ears

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H483.def: = state in which humans or animals are unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H4341.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1672.def: = state in which humans experience fear, anxiety, or distress ◄ out of uncertainty of what might happen to themselves or their beloved ones; ► which may express itself in trembling and shaking of the body

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H6105.def: = state in which humans are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H7231.def: = process by which people, objects, and events increase in number or frequency

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2363.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H8668.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need
